alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 30 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central New Jersey...including the following counties...Middlesex...Mercer and Monmouth. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 400 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... New Brunswick, Perth Amboy, Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Somerset, Edison, Lakewood, Middletown, Old Bridge, Howell, and East Brunswick. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 8 and 13. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 58 and 59...and between mile markers 61 and 67. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 16...and between mile markers 26 and 34. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 10. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 95 and 134. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
